reviewText: This is the beginning of the series with Aliens and humans getting along. However, there are humans that do think the Aliens are that benevolent which maybe true. Do not be so trusting.  Gene Roddenberry is a great Alien writer for sci-fi  shows that some people like to watch.  I really enjoyed the Earth series along with other series he has created.
We liked the series so well that we bought all of the seasons.  Thought provoking series, that should be in any serious Sci-Fi collection.
Finally whole series released - Ive Waitng along time for this series to come out on DVD or Blu Ray.
i really liked the show when it was on and I'm glad it is finally all on DVD. I didn't buy year 5 as I felt that year was a joke.

Gene Roddenberry's Earth: Final Conflict - Season OneEarth - Final Conflict - Season 2 (Boxset)Earth: Final Conflict - The Complete Third Season As a fan of anything "Star Trek" it was worth taking a look at "Earth - Final Conflict". Although the cast is largely unknown, the story line is enough to keep interest going. The concept of aliens visiting Earth as being friendly and secretly having a different agenda has been done before but the plot sill has plenty of twists and turns. On that basis, I recommend you give this a go.
Box sets (1), (2), (4) & (5) all discs had scratches on them, some bad enough that the section had to be skipped as they stopped playing.

My wife and I watched this series when it was on many years ago and have patiently waited for the release of the entire series (we could have done without season five but maybe we'll enjoy it this time around). We were not interested in purchasing one season at a time. We wanted to wait.

Although we're still in season one, I can say that seeing it without commercial breaks, and all those tight cuts that were used to get as much advertizing in as possible, has really enhanced our enjoyment. I'd also say that, so far, it's even better than we remember.

I know everyone complains about the packaging, and I agree, it could have been done better. That said, with a little care, you can get the disks in and out without doing any major damage (except to your nerves).

If you were a fan of the series or, you're just looking for something completely different in sci-fi, I don''t think you'll be disappointed.
